WELCOME EXPERIENCE PORTFOLIO

Christie Corcoran

Projects

Towards the end 2020 and continuing through the start of 2021, I was enrolled in a Full Stack Web Development class. This class enhanced my knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript while introducing me to new to me technologies such as React, Django, python, Node.js and others. The following is a list of projects submitted for that class. Each project below contains a link to the code in GitHub as well as a link to try the web app out.

Taking this class reminded and reinforced my love of programming. Thanks for taking a look!

Fun web app used to search gifs. Giphy Search uses API endpoints surfaced by GIPHY to allow the user the ability to search for trending gifs, browse through categories of gifs, or search for gifs. The user can keep track of their favorites as well as copy a link to a gif.

A task management web app. Life List allows the user to create, edit, and delete events to help manage and organize their lives. There is not a backend component to Life List as it was simply an exercise to demonstrate knowledge in React, React Router, and Redux. An extremely rudimentary authentication system is included. A password is not even needed to gain access.

Note: This application is hosted on Heroku. It may take up to a minute for the Linux container to wake up.

A cryptocurrency trading web app. Money XChange allows users to view current cryptocurrency prices. When a user creates an account on Money XChange, they are given $10,000 in a pretend account to buy crytocurrencies. Purchased cryptocurrencies will remain in their portfolio even after they have logged out. Users can then sell them whenever they'd like for the current price. Database tables are used to store a user's account, portfolio, and transactions as well as cryptocurrency information.

Note: This application is not functioning properly at the moment. Money XChange will still render; however, the stock information cannot be returned. I suspect that the REST endpoints have changed or my account has been deactivated. Also note, this application is hosted on Heroku. It may take up to a minute for the Linux container to wake up.

A health forum web application. Health Overflow allows users to view questions and answers on a variety of health related topics. Once registered and authenticated, a user can post questions or reply to existing ones. Authentication was done using Passport.js.

Note: This application is hosted on Heroku. It may take up to a minute for the Linux container to wake up. After that, although the application renders, the database may take a minute longer.
